intro: Senecio barkleyanus, commonly known as the Barkley's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, blue-gray leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Senecio barkleyanus is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in coastal or mountainous areas.
